title: VPMOVB2M/VPMOVW2M/VPMOVD2M/VPMOVQ2M â€” Convert a Vector Register to a Mask

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPMOVB2M k1, xmm1`
`VPMOVB2M k1, ymm1`
`VPMOVB2M k1, zmm1`
`VPMOVW2M k1, xmm1`
`VPMOVW2M k1, ymm1`
`VPMOVW2M k1, zmm1`
`VPMOVD2M k1, xmm1`
`VPMOVD2M k1, ymm1`
`VPMOVD2M k1, zmm1`
`VPMOVQ2M k1, xmm1`
`VPMOVQ2M k1, ymm1`
`VPMOVQ2M k1, zmm1`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Converts a vector register to a mask register. Each element in the destination register is set to 1 or 0 depending on the value of most significant bit of the corresponding element in the source register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The destination operand is a mask register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
